discussion.content:
Must be: B
page 6, https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/vsphere-esxi-vcenter-server-67-host-profiles-guide.pdf

Host profile can be applied to each Host or Cluster. If no cluster, Profile needs to be applied at individual host level.

Answer is B
Host Profiles can be applied to individual hosts, a cluster, or all the hosts and clusters associated to a host profile
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/vsphere-esxi-vcenter-server-67-host-profiles-guide.pdf

Correct: B 
Due profiles only can be applied at hosts or cluster level
The question is wrong. Shoud be "Single Datacenter"

questions.question_text:
An administrator runs vSphere Infrastructure in the following configuration:
✑ Single vCenter
✑ Multiple vCenters
✑ Multiple clusters under each data center, all with identical hardware
The administrator wants to use host profiles to manage the hosts.
Where should the administrator attach the host profile?

A vSphere administrator discovers the size of the .vswp file for a VM with 2 vCPUs and 4GB of memory is zero.
What could be the cause?

choices.C: VM is running on a snapshot.
choices.A: VM is in a suspended state.

discussion.content: if we discuss protecting the confidential data, shouldn't we use the native (from 6.5) VM Encryption?

Answer is B. 

VDP (vSphere Data Protection) does not ensure confidentiality. You can read more on VDP here: https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2016565

The word confidential is the key element , making backups does not help in this aspect.
Confidential = Encryption

questions.question_text: Which native feature could be used to protect virtual machine files and disks containing confidential customer data?
After installing vCenter, which two identity sources and users are available by default? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
It's B and E - it wouldn't let me correct my last post!
See: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.psc.doc/GUID-B23B1360-8838-4FF2-B074-71643C4CB040.html

An administrator wants to ensure the VMs for two different departments are separated on a single broadcast domain.
Which configuration fulfills this requirement?
